article_metadata.description: Houston-based University General Health System Inc. announced Tuesday the elimination of nearly 100 jobs, including 34 from its local operations.  "Given the dynamic nature of the health care industry and our disappointing financial performance in 2013, we determined that drastic measures were required to remain competitive and restore profitability," said Dr. Hassan Chahadeh, the health system's chairman and CEO, in a written statement.  Baltimore, Md., analyst Rob Goldman of Goldman Small Cap Research said Tuesday's announcement by University General indicates the health system is on the right track.  Besides two hospitals, University General operates several ambulatory surgical centers, diagnostic imaging, physical therapy and sleep clinics and a hyperbaric wound care center.
article_metadata.author.name: By Lora Hines

Baltimore, Md., analyst Rob Goldman of Goldman Small Cap Research said Tuesday's announcement by University General indicates the health system is on the right track.  Besides two hospitals, University General operates several ambulatory surgical centers, diagnostic imaging, physical therapy and sleep clinics and a hyperbaric wound care center.
og.title: Houston health system cuts jobs
